intro: Meliosma isthmensis, commonly known as the Isthmus meliosma, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with distinct sepals and petals. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
